title: What is this font?
content:
What font makes up 'Green papaya'? I can't determine....

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [GPfont.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20131019013038/http:/typophile.com/files/GPfont.jpg) | 28.29 KB |
author: Cole

comments.content: I just can't figure it out. It is similar to Mistral....sort of.....but not really..... Please help!

It’s Samurai, by MicroLogic Software, Inc., 1994.

That said, MicroLogic “borrowed” some (most?) of its designs from other foundries,\* so maybe there’s another (earlier) version around.

\* [http://www.sanskritweb.net/forgers/#MLS](http://web.archive.org/web/20131019013038/http:/www.sanskritweb.net/forgers/#MLS "http://www.sanskritweb.net/forgers/#MLS")

Thank you so much Riccard0!  
I really appreciate you doing that for me.  
Let me know if I can ever help you out in return!  
Best,  
Cole

Found it: it’s Present, designed by Friedrich K. Sallwey for Linotype in 1974.  
 [http://new.myfonts.com/search/name%3Apresent/fonts/](http://web.archive.org/web/20131019013038/http:/new.myfonts.com/search/name%3Apresent/fonts/ "http://new.myfonts.com/search/name%3Apresent/fonts/")
